alert.note: Alert for Cherokee (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 15 at 4:50PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Cherokee County through 515 PM CDT... At 450 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Forney, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Forney, Pleasant Gap, Eastern Weiss Lake and Coloma. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
